thread.title: Nevis ready for romance

author: eTN Editor
title: Nevis ready for romance
text:
Ready, Set, Love Nevis ready for romance 
NEW YORK, New York - The Nevis Tourism Authority (NTA) has been busy preparing for what is sure to be an exciting and informative event. USA Today has claimed Nevis as the “Best Romantic Caribbean Island” and attendees to the symposium are sure to experience why, first hand. They’ll gain a unique perspective on the island while discovering its charm, exquisite dining, exclusive world-class resorts, and some of the finest and most pristine shores in the Caribbean. 
For the island and the people, this air of exclusive romance comes naturally. However, much preparation has taken place in order to ready the symposium to deliver. After weeks of hard work, everything is in place now from the venues, stakeholders and all of the romance travel suppliers on Nevis. 
Many attendees from around the globe have already arrived including speakers Paula McCory, Nancy Barkley, and Natalie John, with Keith Powell arriving later today. These four individuals represent everything from Social Media, Taste Influencing, Honeymoons and Getaways to Wedding Planning and Business Revival, and are highly regarded in each of their respective fields. 
Thanks to the Yu Lounge and their partnership with the NTA, all attendees will immediately receive that warm Nevis love as soon as they arrive. The Yu Lounge is a private airport terminal with a luxurious lounge, concierge and FBO services. It is specifically designed for discerning business jet and airline passengers and even has its own in-house gourmet chef who will provide tantalizing and mouthwatering foods for the lounge’s arrivals. 
The official opening of the symposium is tonight and includes a welcome reception and dinner at the world-class, multi award winning Four Seasons Resort Nevis . US News has the resort in its Best Hotels in the Caribbean list for 2015 and has been highly regarded in the world of travel and resorts for over the past 20 years. Whatever your pleasure or desire, the Four Seasons Resort Nevis has a proven track record of delivering. 
The evening event will kick off with electrifying welcomes from the Honorable Premier, Mr. Vance Amory, the Honorable Minister of Tourism, Mr. Mark Brantley, Mr. Greg Phillip CEO of the Nevis Tourism Authority and Ms. Natalie John of Dreamy Weddings . 
Dreamy Weddings is another partner for the event and is co-hosting the symposium along with the NTA. Whether you’re looking for a romantic getaway or an unforgettable wedding, Dreamy Weddings can help plan everything needed for a truly timeless memory. 
In addition to the impressive list of welcome speakers, attendees will be treated to a number of exciting cultural presentations. Dinner and a show is always a solid first date. After dinner, guests are encouraged to have a rejuvenating night sleep for the following day’s activities including speaking sessions, a tradeshow, and site visits. 
Find more info on the event at Nevis Travel Symposium . 
Bookings to and from Nevis can be made via the Nevis website - Nevis Island . 
About Nevis 
Nevis is part of the Federation of St. Kitts & Nevis and is located in the Leeward Islands of the West Indies. Conical in shape with a volcanic peak at its center known as Nevis Peak, the island is the birthplace of the founding father of the United States, Alexander Hamilton. The weather is typical of most of the year with temperatures in the low to mid-80s°F/mid 20-30s°C, cool breezes and low chances of precipitation. Air transportation is easily available with connections from Puerto Rico, and St. Kitts. For more information about Nevis, travel packages and accommodations, please contact the Nevis Tourism Authority, USA Tel 1.407.287.5204, Canada 1.403.770.6697 or our website and on Facebook – Nevis Naturally . Oct 21, 2015
